channel.title: [help]bsod[help]
channel.description:
Guy, I really need your help. I can't start my computer as I keep getting the BSOD. I'm in Safe Mode w/Networking right now. I can't do a System Restore because anytime I try, I get errors. If anyone can help me figure out what is happening, I would [u][b]REALLY[/b][/u] appreciate it.
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/15d75go.png[/img]

item.title: [help]bsod[help]
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:25, topic:273365”]Alright guys, I’m switching over to Ubuntu Linux. Wish me luck. If I ask questions. Please help.[/quote]NO! Don’t go over to the dark side!

Wise choice, btw. Better to switch to it now, than later.

Read full topic

item.title: [help]bsod[help]
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

runescape3dude:

look at that. It doesn’t even render with Chromes engine, it uses KHTML. Pretty useless if you ask me.

Did you ever read the user agent of the chrome browser under windows? It says exactly the same thing. And weirdly the user agent of chrome and safari are nearly identical.

Read full topic

item.title: [help]bsod[help]
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:23, topic:273365”][quote author=cocoa link=topic=361267.msg2748580#msg2748580 date=1239767461]

pretty sure chrome is released for ubuntu

It is, so you can use it if you really want to.
[/quote]Lies, it’s not a native build. It’s just wine.

So they lied to get me to switch over :’(

Theres nothing wrong with running windows programs in Wine but I can confirm that Chrome will definatly not work.
http://appdb.winehq.org/objectManager.php?sClass=version&iId=14823[/quote]
brb sound recorder

Read full topic

item.title: [help]bsod[help]
item.dc:creator: @Creme_de_la_Creme Creme de la Creme
item.description:
@Creme_de_la_Creme wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:11, topic:273365”]Do they have Google Chrome for Ubuntu Linux?[/quote]I don’t think there’s a specific build but you can manage to run it with wine. Chromes hardly an influence in changing os anyway

Edit~
Here’s a tutorial I can pretend I wrote:

  1. install wine (follow the official instructions http://www.winehq.org/site/download-deb)

  2. make sure wine >= 1.1.3 is installed by entering the following in the terminal
    wine --version

  3. Download winetricks and install it

[code]wget http://www.kegel.com/wine/winetricks
sudo cp winetricks /usr/sbin

  1. Install some dependencies for Chrome (Flash is not mandatory but will allow you to play youtube videos :-))
    winetricks riched20 riched30 flash
    [/code]4.1 Install allfonts (this is optional)
    winetricks allfonts

  2. Download the Chrome installer
    wget http://gpdl.google.com/chrome/install/149.27/chrome_installer.exe

  3. Install Chrome (just follow the onscreen instructions and make sure you create a desktop icon)
    wine chrome_installer.exe


7. After the install is finished, you won’t be able to use Chrome as it needs a bit more hacking. Just close it and opent with your favorite editor the Google Chrome.desktop icon created on your Desktop. Make sure your add “–new-http --in-process-plugins”, without the quotes at the end of this line:

Exec=env WINEPREFIX=/home/mimir/.wine" wine “C:\windows\profiles\mimir\Local Settings\Application Data\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe”

to make it look like this:
Exec=env WINEPREFIX=/home/mimir/.wine" wine “C:\windows\profiles\mimir\Local Settings\Application Data\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe” --new-http --in-process-plugins

Save the file!

NOTE: mimir is my username, you will have something like /home/yourusername/.wine

  1. Go to desktop and start Google Chrome
    Checking some youtube videos


For those who are not able to find the Google Chrome.desktop icon on their Desktop, i have attached a copy of mine here. Just save the attached file on your desktop, and edit it using your favorite text editor. Only things you need to replace is my username (mimir) with your own.

HTTPS Note: it seems that the https is not working due to the fact that wine is missing TSL/SSL features, the dlls that should handle that being just stubs at the moment. If you have any information regarding this, please share.

Resources:
Wine appdb page for Chrome
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=908493

Read full topic
